summary: Interactive romantic Valentine web page (HTML/CSS/JS) with Yes/No buttons where No evades hover clicks and Yes reveals a 'Good choice' meme image; designed to run on iPad Chrome with a pink/white theme.
architectural_notes: Single-page interactive web app using HTML/CSS/JavaScript, optimized for running locally in Chrome on iPad.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Meme-style image with a cute romantic aesthetic, bold readable caption text “GOOD CHOICE”, and heart/pink accents (good-choice-meme.dim_900x600.png)

existing_features.title: Create a single-page interactive Valentine prompt that has only one purpose: asking the user to be the author’s Valentine, with two options presented as buttons: “Yes” and “No” (English text).
Implement the “No” button evasive behavior so it moves away when the user tries to interact with it, preventing successful clicks/taps (support both mouse/trackpad and iPad touch).
When the user clicks “Yes”, replace or augment the UI to show a romantic confirmation view that displays a meme image and the text “Good choice”.
Apply a romantic visual theme using a pink and white color scheme with consistent typography, spacing, and UI styling across the page.
Ensure the page is fully interactive and works smoothly in iPad Chrome (responsive layout, touch-friendly hit targets, and no reliance on hover-only interactions).
Add the generated meme image as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and render it in the “Yes” success state.

new_feature_requests.summary: Build a simple romantic-themed Valentine proposal web page (pink/white) in HTML/CSS/JS runnable on iPad Chrome
Add Yes/No options where the No button moves away on hover to prevent clicking
On Yes click, display a meme image with the text 'Good choice'

projectName: Romantic Valentine single-page with evasive 'No' button and 'Good choice' meme reveal
